rule.name: Then Try Rule
rule.description: You always should place 'begin' statement after 'try', this helps to prevent errors.

rule.message: Only one class in a file
rule.name: One Class Per File Rule
rule.description: On class should be included in one file, for clarity reasons.

rule.message: Inherited method, with no additional code.
rule.name: Inherited Method With No Code Rule
rule.description: Some methods that only inherits parent method behaviour are not needed (redundant).

rule.name: Empty Except Block Rule
rule.description: Empty 'except' block, you should catch some exceptions.
rule.example: try ( ... code ... ) except //WRONG, except statement does not catch anything end;

rule.name: Empty Interface Rule
rule.description: You may have forgotten to fill some interface with methods.

rule.name: Too Long Method Rule
rule.description: Function may be too long, if so you should shorten it.

rule.name: Too Many Arguments Rule
rule.description: Function may have too many arguments, maximum number of arguments is 6

rule.name: Too Many Variables Rule
rule.description: Function may have too many variables, maximum number of variables is 10

rule.name: No Semi After Overload Rule
rule.description: You should put semicolon ';' after 'overload' keyword, at the end of method declaration.
rule.example: procedure foo1(x: integer); overload //WRONG, no ; at end procedure foo2(x: integer); overload; //GOOD

rule.name: No Function Return Type Rule
rule.description: All functions should have return type specified.
rule.example: function TMainWindow.foo(x : byte); //WRONG, no return type function TMainWindow.foo(x : byte): integer; //GOOD

rule.message: Interface name must begin with 'I' letter
rule.name: Interface Name Rule
rule.description: Interface name should began with 'I' letter.

rule.message: Class name must begin with 'T' letter
rule.name: Class Name Rule
rule.description: Class name should began with 'T' letter.

rule.message: Record name must begin with 'T' letter
rule.name: Record Name Rule
rule.description: Record name should began with 'T' letter.

rule.name: Catching General Exception Rule
rule.description: You should not catch general exceptions but descendants of Exception class.
rule.example: except on e : Exception do //WRONG, catching general Exception class except on e : MyException do //GOOD, catching specific exception type

rule.name: Raising General Exception Rule
rule.description: You should not raise a general Exception class.
rule.example: raise Exception.create('blah'); //WRONG, raising general exception class raise MyException.create('blah'); //GOOD, raising specific exception

rule.name: Avoid Out Parameter Rule
rule.description: Avoid 'out' variable parameters. Nasty.

rule.name: If True Rule
rule.description: You don't need to write 'if x = true', this is redundant. Instead write 'if x'.

rule.message: Change from 'if not (x=false)' to 'if not x'
rule.name: If Not False Rule
rule.description: You don't need to write 'if not (x = false)', this is redundant. Instead write 'if x'.

rule.name: Public Fields Rule
rule.description: You shouldn't make public fields. Make them private/protected and add a getter/setter methods.

rule.name: Unused Arguments Rule
rule.description: You should always use every passed function argument.

rule.name: No Guid Rule
rule.description: Every interface should contain unique Guid.

rule.message: You don't have to check for assignement when calling Free
rule.name: Assigned And Free Rule
rule.description: Free() method does check if the freed variable is not nil, you don't have to do it manually.
rule.example: if Assigned(x) then x.Free; //WRONG if x <> nil then x.Free; //WRONG x.Free; //GOOD, sufficent enough

rule.name: Empty Else Statement Rule
rule.description: You should not write an empty 'else' statement.

rule.name: Empty Begin Statement Rule
rule.description: You should not write an empty 'begin' statement.

rule.name: Project File No Functions Rule
rule.description: .dpr/.dpk files should not have procedures/functions.

rule.name: Project File No Variables Rule
rule.description: .dpr/.dpk files should not have variables.

rule.name: Type Alias Rule
rule.description: You should not use type aliases.

property.name: xpath
property.value: //TkNewType/*[count(descendant::*) < 3 and name(descendant::*) != 'class' and name(descendant::*) != 'record' and name(descendant::*) != 'array' and name(descendant::*) != 'set' and name(descendant::*) != 'dash_pointer']

rule.name: Uppercase Reserved Keywords Rule
rule.description: Avoid using uppercase reserverd keywords.

rule.message: Avoid using mixed names for functions / variables.
rule.name: Mixed Names Rule
rule.description: Avoid using uppercase reserverd keywords.

rule.name: Unused Unit Rule
rule.description: Unused unit. No other unit has this unit in it's uses section. Probably you could remove this unit from project.

rule.name: Constructor Without Inherited Statement Rule
rule.description: Constructor without 'inherited' statement.

rule.name: Destructor Without Inherited Statement Rule
rule.description: Destructor without 'inherited' statement.

rule.name: No 'begin' after 'do' Rule
rule.description: 'Begin' statement should be placed after 'do' statement to prevent errors.

rule.name: With After Do/Then Rule
rule.description: 'with' statement directly after 'do' or 'then', 'begin' was omited

rule.message: No semicolon at the end of code block.
rule.name: No Semicolon Rule
rule.description: No semicolon at the end of code block.

rule.name: Cast And Free Rule
rule.description: You should not cast an object before freeing it.
